sen.j: 俊士(しゅんし)とは、平安時代以降、文章生に与えられた称号。
sen.e: Shunshi is the title given to monjosho (student of literary studies in the Imperial universities.)

sen.j: 俊士は大学寮の学生たる文章生に与えられた称号である。
sen.e: Shunshi is the title given to monjosho who were the students of Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the Ritsuryo system.)

sen.j: 大学平安時代初期、文章生が良家の子弟に限られた際に、成績優秀なる文章生5名に与えられた称号として定められた。
sen.e: Shunshi was set as a title given to the five students who made the most excellent achievement during the early Heian Period when monjosho was limited to children from good families.

During the early Heian Period when monjosho was limited to children from privileged families, Shunshi was established as a title given to the five monjosho students with the highest scholastic standing.

sen.j: その後、良家以外の者についても俊士に補せられるようになったが、後に再び良家以外の者も文章生となる機会が拡がるにつれ、俊士の称号も廃された。
sen.e: Later shunshi came to be also selected from students other than ones from good families, and after that with the increasing chances of students from other than good families being able to be a monjosho, the title of shunshi was abolished.

Shunshi later began to be made up of students other than those from privileged families, and as chances to become monjosho were extended to students who were not from privileged families, the title of shunshi fell into disuse.

sen.j: 平安時代末期に至り、明経問者生を俊士と呼んだ例がある。
sen.e: At the end of Heian Period, there were some cases of calling myogyo-kanja-sho (a student who is a master of myokyo, Chinese classics of Confucianism) as shunshi.
